alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Kenedy; Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 25 at 6:29AM CDT until May 25 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN KENEDY...CAMERON AND WILLACY COUNTIES... At 629 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 27 miles northeast of Port Mansfield to Holly Beach to near Santa Maria, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, San Benito, Raymondville, Los Fresnos, South Padre Island, Lyford, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley and Arroyo City. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
